body.p:
To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky:

The petition of B. F. Talbott of Bourbon County, respectfully represents, that he was indicted in the Bourbon circuit court for an assault on John Sullivan, and at the last October Term of said Court was fined $75 which fine he prays to be remitted --

He states that the said fine was inflicted upon the evidence of John Sullivan who is his enemy, and upon Statements made by him which are untrue. He states that said Sullivan at the time of said pretended assault commenced by abusing him, and made an assault on him with a knife drawn in his hand, and he struck him with a chair in self defence and so as to prevent the use of the knife -- He states that he has paid the share of the said fine to the which belongs to the attorney for the commonwealth, & he prays for the remission of the residue --
The above petition was this day signed and sworn to by B. F. Talbott before me presiding Judge of said county of Bourbon this 4 -- January 1861.

p.hi: M. Samuel P. J. B. C
